meanings.definition: A heading given to a subsection of a piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The textbook had clear subheadings for each chapter.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use subheadings to organize your essay effectively.
meanings.sent3: The subheadings in the book were like little signposts guiding the reader.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, with thoughts neatly arranged under different subheadings.
meanings.sent5: The subheadings acted as a roadmap, leading the reader through the text smoothly.

meanings.definition: A title or heading that comes before or after a main heading.
meanings.sent1: The subheadings in the magazine articles were eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: The subheadings in the newspaper helped readers quickly find the main topics.
meanings.sent3: The subheadings at the buffet made the food seem more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like subheadings, adding a touch of humor to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The subheadings on the map made navigation in the city much easier.
